title: Alternatives to House Girard
content:
I've designed a logo which uses House Girard, but due to their ridiculous EULA I can't even dream up to money to pay for it. It's a perfect script font but still remains ledgible. The main thing is the S looks like an S and the r looks like an r without loops and frills but still has an elegant quality to it. I have searched through so many script fonts and not come up with anything of a similar quality.

ANY suggestions are welcome.

comments.content:
Hi Matt,  
have you tried [contacting House Industries](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424013055/http:/www.houseind.com/contact/)?  
From their [Pricing Chart](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424013055/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/licensing/pricing):  
<cite>Logo Usage and Product for Sale – There is no additional charge for companies under $5 million (US Dollars) in annual gross revenue.</cite>

For alternatives: what about [Elena Albertoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424013055/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Elena%20Albertoni)’s [Dolce](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424013055/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/anatoletype/dolce/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D72%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DSuper%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.calt%252Cot.clig%252Cot.liga%252Cot.cswh%26seed%3D25?refby=mfde)?  
F

Interestingly, I thought the Girard Script 'r' looks like a 'v', at least when it's by itself, but I agree the script easy to read and the way it partially connects is nicely done. Their OpenType ligatures are usually well-implemented.

If you are still considering alternatives I like a couple of Victor De Castro's handwritten fonts: [Hudson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424013055/http:/www.unifonts.com/h_family/hudsonfam.htm), [Hudson Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424013055/http:/www.unifonts.com/h_family/hudsonserifam.htm) and [Arturis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424013055/http:/www.unifonts.com/a_family/arturisfam.htm). One thing I like about these is they are not often seen (where House fonts can become trendy, like Neutraface and Chalet) and they seem to blend a casual quality with a professional lettering skill, not always an easy balance to find. I use Arturis and Hudson Serif a lot myself.

- Mike Yanega

Wendy LP has the same feel:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150424013055im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture_6_6631.jpg)
Thanks so much for your replies, I'll check them all out!
